newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Reasonable profit growth this year-Metcash.
newsitem.headline: Reasonable profit growth this year-Metcash.

text.p: South African retailer Metro Cash and Carry Ltd said on Wednesday it expected reasonable profit growth in the current year.

Managing director Carlos dos Santos said the group should make further market share gains at home and with continuing strong offshore growth he expected "a reasonable increase in profits in the coming year".
However, the level of crime and continued high interest rates in the country were a major cause for concern and would likely prevent an improvement in the economy and consumer spending.
"Expectations are that the current year's economic climate will remain difficult with little, if any, respite for hardpressed consumers," dos Santos said in a statement.

"Notwithstanding this outlook, the group's positioning in the marketplace as well as its domestic and international expansion programmes should yield satisfactory results in the year ahead," he added.
The group on Wednesday reported a 25 percent increase in year headline earnings per share to 17 cents while the dividend also rose by 25 percent.
Attributable income rose by 35 percent to 156.4 million rand for the year.
